20 def clampValue(val, valMax):
21  """ Makes sure that a value is within [-valMax, valMax] """
22  if valMax == None: return val
23  if val > valMax: return valMax
24  elif val < -1*valMax: return -1*valMax
25  else: return val
26 
27 class PIDController:
28  """!@brief Discrete PID controller approximated using the Tustin (trapezoid) approximation """
29  def __init__(self, kp=0, ki=0, kd=0, ts=0, feedforward=0, bufferLength=3) -> None:
30  #self.bufferLength = bufferLength
31  self.k1 = 0
32  self.k2 = 0
33  self.k3 = 0
34  self.e = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
35  self.y = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
36  self.feedforward = feedforward
37  if ts != 0: self.setConstants(kp, ki, kd, ts)
38  #
39  def setConstants(self, kp, ki, kd, ts):
40  """ Updates controller constants """
41  self.k1 = kp+((ki*ts)/2)+((2*kd)/ts)
42  self.k2 = ki*ts-((4*kd)/ts)
43  self.k3 = (-1*kp)+((ki*ts)/2)+((2*kd)/ts)
44  #
45  def update(self, e):
46  """
47  Performs one discrete controller update
48 
49  Receives: Input signal [float]
50  Returns: Output signal [float]
51  """
52  # Update buffered input and output signals
53  self.e = [e]+self.e[:len(self.e)-1]
54  self.y = [0]+self.y[:len(self.y)-1]
55  # Shorten variable names for better readability
56  e = self.e
57  y = self.y
58  # Calculate output signal and return output
59  y[0] = e[0]*self.k1 + e[1]*self.k2 + e[2]*self.k3 + y[2]
60  return y[0] + e[0]*self.feedforward
61 
62 class PT1Block:
63  """!@brief Discrete PT1 block approximated using the Tustin (trapezoid) approximation """
64  def __init__(self, kp=1, T1=0, ts=0, bufferLength=2) -> None:
65  self.k1 = 0
66  self.k2 = 0
67  self.e = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
68  self.y = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
69  if ts != 0: self.setConstants(kp, T1, ts)
70  #
71  def setConstants(self, kp, T1, ts):
72  """ Updates controller constants """
73  t = 2*(T1/ts)
74  self.k1 = kp/(1+t)
75  self.k2 = (1-t)/(1+t)
76  #
77  def update(self, e):
78  """
79  Performs one discrete controller update
80 
81  Receives: Input signal [float]
82  Returns: Output signal [float]
83  """
84  # Update buffered input and output signals
85  self.e = [e]+self.e[:len(self.e)-1]
86  self.y = [0]+self.y[:len(self.y)-1]
87  # Shorten variable names for better readability
88  e = self.e
89  y = self.y
90  # Calculate output signal and return output
91  y[0] = (e[0] + e[1])*self.k1 - y[1]*self.k2
92  return y[0]
93 
94 class DBlock:
95  """!@brief Discrete D Block approximated using the Tustin approximation """
96  def __init__(self, kd=0, ts=0, bufferLength=2) -> None:
97  self.k = 0
98  self.e = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
99  self.y = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
100  if ts != 0: self.setConstants(kd, ts)
101  #
102  def setConstants(self, kd, ts):
103  """ Updates controller constants """
104  self.k = (2*kd)/ts
105  #
106  def update(self, e):
107  """
108  Performs one discrete controller update
109 
110  Receives: Input signal [float]
111  Returns: Output signal [float]
112  """
113  if self.k == 0: return 0
114  # Update buffered input and output signals
115  self.e = [e]+self.e[:len(self.e)-1]
116  self.y = [0]+self.y[:len(self.y)-1]
117  # Shorten variable names for better readability
118  e = self.e
119  y = self.y
120  # Calculate output signal and return output
121  y[0] = e[0]*self.k - e[1]*self.k - y[1]
122  return y[0]
123 
124 class PT2Block:
125  """!@brief Discrete PT2 Block approximated using the Tustin approximation """
126  def __init__(self, T=0, D=0, kp=1, ts=0, bufferLength=3) -> None:
127  self.k1 = 0
128  self.k2 = 0
129  self.k3 = 0
130  self.k4 = 0
131  self.k5 = 0
132  self.k6 = 0
133  self.e = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
134  self.y = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
135  if ts != 0: self.setConstants(T, D, kp, ts)
136  #
137  def setConstants(self, T, D, kp, ts):
138  """ Updates controller constants """
139  self.k1 = 4*T**2 + 4*D*T*ts + ts**2
140  self.k2 = 2*ts**2 - 8*T**2
141  self.k3 = 4*T**2 - 4*D*T*ts + ts**2
142  self.k4 = kp*ts**2
143  self.k5 = 2*kp*ts**2
144  self.k6 = kp*ts**2
145  #
146  def update(self, e):
147  """
148  Performs one discrete controller update
149 
150  Receives: Input signal [float]
151  Returns: Output signal [float]
152  """
153  # Update buffered input and output signals
154  self.e = [e]+self.e[:len(self.e)-1]
155  self.y = [0]+self.y[:len(self.y)-1]
156  # Shorten variable names for better readability
157  e = self.e
158  y = self.y
159  # Calculate output signal and return output
160  y[0] = ( e[0]*self.k4 + e[1]*self.k5 + e[2]*self.k6 - y[1]*self.k2 - y[2]*self.k3 )/self.k1
161  return y[0]
162 
163 class smartPID:
164  """!@brief Implementation to mimick HEBI PID controller behaviour. Variable names are consistent with HEBI Gains format """
165  def __init__(self, kp=0, ki=0, kd=0, targetLP=0, outputLP=0, ts=0, feedforward=0, d_on_error=True, targetMax=None, outputMax=None) -> None:
166  self.d_on_error = d_on_error
167  if d_on_error:
168  self.PID = PIDController(kp=kp, ki=ki, kd=kd, ts=ts)
169  self.D = DBlock(kd=0, ts=ts)
170  else:
171  self.PID = PIDController(kp=kp, ki=ki, kd=0, ts=ts)
172  self.D = DBlock(kd=kd, ts=ts)
173  #
174  self.targetLP = targetLP
175  self.outputLP = outputLP
176  self.inputFilter = PT1Block(kp=1, T1=targetLP, ts=ts)
177  self.outputFilter = PT1Block(kp=1, T1=outputLP, ts=ts)
178  #
179  self.targetMax = targetMax
180  self.outputMax = outputMax
181  self.feedforward = feedforward
182  #
183  def setConstants(self, kp, ki, kd, ts):
184  """ Updates controller constants """
185  if self.d_on_error:
186  self.PID.setConstants(kp, ki, kd, ts)
187  else:
188  self.PID.setConstants(kp, ki, 0, ts)
189  self.D.setConstants(kd, ts)
190  #
191  self.inputFilter = PT1Block(kp=1, T1=self.targetLP, ts=ts)
192  self.outputFilter = PT1Block(kp=1, T1=self.outputLP, ts=ts)
193  #
194  def update(self, target, feedback):
195  """
196  Performs one discrete controller update
197 
198  Receives: Input signal [float]
199  Returns: Output signal [float]
200  """
201  # Clamp and low pass input
202  filteredInput = self.inputFilter.update(
203  clampValue(target, self.targetMax)
204  )
205  # Update internal control blocks
206  output = self.D.update(filteredInput) + self.PID.update(filteredInput - feedback)
207  # Clamp and low pass output
208  output = self.outputFilter.update(
209  clampValue(output + self.feedforward*filteredInput, self.outputMax)
210  )
211  return output
212 
213 class strategy4Controller:
214  """!@brief Models HEBI control strategy 4 using 3 PID controllers discretised using the tustin approximation """
215  def __init__(self, ts=0, targetConstraints=[None, 3.43, 20], outputConstraints=[10, 1, 1], feedfowards=[0, 1, 1], d_on_errors=[True, True, False], constants=None) -> None:
216  """ Class constructor """
217  self.ts = ts
218  #
219  self.PositionPID = smartPID(
220  targetMax=targetConstraints[0],
221  outputMax=outputConstraints[0],
222  feedforward=feedfowards[0],
223  d_on_error=d_on_errors[0]
224  )
225  #
226  self.VelocityPID = smartPID(
227  targetMax=targetConstraints[1],
228  outputMax=outputConstraints[1],
229  feedforward=feedfowards[1],
230  d_on_error=d_on_errors[1],
231  outputLP=0.01
232  )
233  #
234  self.EffortPID = smartPID(
235  targetMax=targetConstraints[2],
236  outputMax=outputConstraints[2],
237  feedforward=feedfowards[2],
238  d_on_error=d_on_errors[2],
239  outputLP=0.001
240  )
241  #
242  self.PWMFilter = PT2Block(kp=1, T=0.0, D=10, ts=self.ts)
243  if constants != None: self.updateConstants(constants)
244  #
245  def updateConstants(self, constants):
246  """ Updates controller constants """
247  self.PositionPID.setConstants(constants[0], constants[1], constants[2], self.ts)
248  self.VelocityPID.setConstants(constants[3], constants[4], constants[5], self.ts)
249  self.EffortPID.setConstants( constants[6], constants[7], constants[8], self.ts)
250  #
251  def update(self, vecIn, feedback):
252  """
253  Takes feedback and control signal and processes output signal
254 
255  Format vecIn & feedback: [pos, vel, effort]
256  """
257  effort = self.PositionPID.update(vecIn[0], feedback[0])
258  PWM1 = self.EffortPID.update(vecIn[2] + effort, feedback[2])
259  PWM2 = self.VelocityPID.update(vecIn[2], feedback[2])
260  return self.PWMFilter.update(PWM1 + PWM2)
261 
262 def PWM2Torque(PWM, maxMotorTorque=7.5):
263  """ Converts PWM output signals of the strategy 4 controller to direct torque outputs (Nm) for Pybullet """
264  # PWM range -> [-1, 1], Since we have X5-4 motors, the max torque is 7.5 Nm
265  # We just assume the conversion to be linear, might be fancier if I have time to measure a more exact conversion
266  # Source: https://docs.hebi.us/core_concepts.html#control-strategies
267  return PWM*maxMotorTorque
268 
269 def deserialiseJointstate(js):
270  """ Converts Jointstate message into the format used for the strategy 4 controller """
271  return [ [pos, vel, eff] for pos, vel, eff in zip(js.position, js.velocity, js.effort) ]
272 
273 class jointcontrol_env(gym.Env):
274  """!@brief Class implementing the control problem as a Gym Environment
275 
276  Observation Space:
277  List of currently set params
278 
279  Action Space:
280  List of how much to change each controller param
281 
282  Reward:
283  Negative mean squared error of control offset
284 
285  """
286  def __init__(self, **kwargs):
287  """ Class constructor """
288  # Get current joint index from keyword arguments
289  self.jointidx = kwargs.get('jointidx', 0)
290 
291  # Load joint controller configuration from ros parameter server
292  assert rospy.has_param("/jointcontrol")
293  params = rospy.get_param("/jointcontrol")
294  assert params["NumJoints"]>self.jointidx
295  self.jointParams = params["J{}".format(self.jointidx)]
296 
297  # Define action space as box[-1, 1] with the same length as the params
298  # Actions are scaled to the different gains, in order for the action noise distribution to be the same for every entry
299  self.action_space = spaces.Box(
300  np.array( [ -1 for _ in self.jointParams["MaxChange"] ], dtype=np.float32 ),
301  np.array( [ 1 for _ in self.jointParams["MaxChange"] ], dtype=np.float32 )
302  )
303 
304  # Define observation space as box with minimum and maximum controller params
305  self.observation_space = spaces.Box (
306  np.array(self.jointParams["Minimums"], dtype=np.float32),
307  np.array(self.jointParams["Maximums"], dtype=np.float32)
308  )
309 
310  # Instantiate controller as a blueprint to store ts and set params
311  self.controllerBlueprint = strategy4Controller(ts=params["SimParams"]["Ts"])
312  self.controllerBlueprint.updateConstants(self.jointParams["Defaults"])
313 
314  self.controllerInstance = None # Current controller instance
315  self.currentParams = None # Currently set control params
316  self.controlSignal = None # Control signal that is applied each step
317  self.numSteps = 0 # Number of performed steps this episode
318  self.maxSteps = 0 # Maximum number of steps per episode
319  self.latestTrajectory = None # Stores the trajectory resulting from the latest sim step
320 
321  # Connect to the bullet server
322  self.physicsClient = p.connect(p.SHARED_MEMORY)
323 
324  # Init ROS node
325  try:
326  rospy.init_node("j{}GymEnv".format(self.jointidx))
327  except rospy.exceptions.ROSException:
328  pass
329 
330  # Create ROS publisher & subscriber to synchronise with physics server
331  self.ready = False
332  self.syncSub = rospy.Subscriber("jointcontrol/globalEnvSync", jointMetric, self.syncCallback)
333  self.syncPub = rospy.Publisher("jointcontrol/envSync", jointMetric, queue_size = 1)
334 
335  def __del__(self):
336  """ Class Deconstructor """
337  p.disconnect()
338 
339  # Gym Env methods
340  # ----------------------------
341  def step(self, action):
342  """ Performs one simulation (as defined with episodeType and config params in env.reset()) """
343 
344  # If action is not within action space, terminate the episode and return
345  if False in [ -1 <= a <= 1 for a in action ]:
346  return self.formatObs(), -10, True, {}
347 
348  # Scale action from [-1, 1] back to params
349  action = np.multiply(
350  np.array(action),
351  np.array(self.jointParams["MaxChange"], dtype=np.float64)
352  )
353 
354  # Calculate current controller params after action
355  self.currentParams += np.array(action)
356 
357  # If action puts the state outside of the observation space, terminate episode and return
358  #if False in [ a <= b <= c for a, b, c in zip(self.jointParams["Minimums"], self.currentParams, self.jointParams["Maximums"]) ]:
359  # return self.formatObs(), -10, True, {}
360 
361  # Clip controller params to Min/Max
362  np.clip(
363  self.currentParams,
364  self.jointParams["Minimums"],
365  self.jointParams["Maximums"],
366  out = self.currentParams
367  )
368 
369  # Set joint to initial position
370  while abs( self.getJointState()[0] - self.controlSignal[0]) > 0.05:
371  self.positionControlUpdate(cmdForce=100, cmdPos=self.controlSignal[0])
372  self.waitForPhysicsUpdate()
373  # Deactivate position control before proceeding
374  self.positionControlUpdate()
375  self.waitForPhysicsUpdate()
376 
377  # Update controller instance
378  self.controllerInstance.updateConstants(self.currentParams)
379 
380  resultingPos = [] # Variable to track resulting motor position
381  feedback = self.getJointState() # Variable to track bullet joint feedback
382 
383  # Iterate over controlsignal
384  for entry in self.controlSignal:
385  # Calculate output torque and apply it to the joint
386  # Since we only test postion control, the vel and effort commands are set to 0
387  torque = PWM2Torque(
388  self.controllerInstance.update([entry, 0, 0], feedback),
389  maxMotorTorque=14
390  )
391  self.torqueControlUpdate(torque)
392  # Wait for synchronisation
393  self.waitForPhysicsUpdate()
394  # Get joint feedback & correct torque value (it is not reported by bullet in torque mode)
395  feedback = self.getJointState()
396  feedback[2] = torque
397  # Log feedback for reward calculation
398  resultingPos.append(feedback[0])
399 
400  # Calculate reward
401  reward = self.compute_reard(resultingPos, self.controlSignal, {})
402 
403  # Keep track of resulting trajectory
404  self.latestTrajectory = resultingPos
405 
406  # Check if end of episode is reached
407  if self.numSteps < self.maxSteps:
408  self.numSteps += 1
409  done = False
410  else:
411  done = True
412 
413  # Return
414  return self.formatObs(), reward, done, {}
415 
416  def reset(self, episodeType='step', config={ "initialPos":0, "stepPos":-1.57, "samplesPerStep":80, "maxSteps":40 }):
417  """
418  Resets environment and returns env observation
419 
420  # TODO: Other testscenarios than step
421  """
422  # Instantiate controller with default params
423  self.controllerInstance = copy.deepcopy(self.controllerBlueprint)
424  self.currentParams = np.array(self.jointParams["Defaults"], dtype=np.float64)
425 
426  # Create control signal and set number of performed steps to 0
427  self.controlSignal = [config["initialPos"]] + [ config["stepPos"] for _ in range(config["samplesPerStep"]-1) ]
428  self.maxSteps = config["maxSteps"]
429  self.numSteps = 0
430 
431  return self.formatObs()
432 
433  def render(self, mode="human"):
434  # No need to render, as it happens in ROS
435  pass
436 
437  # Gym GoalEnv methods
438  # ----------------------------
439  def compute_reard(self, achieved_goal, goal, info):
440  """
441  Computes reward of currently achieved vs. the global goal
442 
443  In this context, the achieved goal is the actual plant position, while the actual goal is to follow the control signal as closely as possible
444 
445  """
446  squaredError = np.square(
447  np.array(achieved_goal) - np.array(goal)
448  )
449  return -1*squaredError.mean()
450 
451  # Environment-specific methods
452  # ----------------------------
453  def formatObs(self):
454  """ Formats observation """
455  obs = self.currentParams
456  return obs
457 
458  def getJointState(self):
459  """ Returns Jointstate in form [pos, vel, effort] """
460  js = p.getJointState(self.jointParams["RobotID"], self.jointParams["SegmentID"])
461  # Return without information about reaction forces
462  return [js[0], js[1], js[3]]
463 
464  def positionControlUpdate(self, cmdForce=0, cmdPos=0):
465  """ Sets up position control for the next physics update """
466  # Set target for next update
467  mode = p.POSITION_CONTROL
468  p.setJointMotorControl2(self.jointParams["RobotID"], self.jointParams["SegmentID"], controlMode=mode, force=cmdForce, targetPosition=cmdPos)
469 
470  def torqueControlUpdate(self, torque):
471  """ Sets up torque control for the next physics update """
472  mode = p.TORQUE_CONTROL
473  p.setJointMotorControl2(self.jointParams["RobotID"], self.jointParams["SegmentID"], controlMode=mode, force=torque)
474 
475  def loadBulletTarget(self):
476  """ Reloads jointparams from ROS in order to enable changing of the testscene without terminating the env """
477  params = rospy.get_param("/jointcontrol")
478  self.jointParams = params["J{}".format(self.jointidx)]
479 
480  def syncCallback(self, data):
481  """ Callback for synchronisation messages """
482  if not True in data.ready:
483  self.ready = False
484 
485  def waitForPhysicsUpdate(self):
486  """ Synchronises env with physics server using ROS messages """
487  # Publish message indicating that env is ready for sim step
488  self.syncPub.publish(
489  jointMetric( [ False for _ in range(self.jointidx) ] + [ True ] )
490  )
491  self.ready = True
492  while self.ready:
493  time.sleep(1/400)
494 
495  def visualiseTrajectory(self):
496  """ Plots control signal vs. resulting trajectory using matplotlib """
497  plt.plot(
498  [ i for i, _ in enumerate(self.controlSignal) ],
499  self.controlSignal,
500  label = "Control Signal"
501  )
502  if self.latestTrajectory != None:
503  plt.plot(
504  [ i for i, _ in enumerate(self.latestTrajectory) ],
505  self.latestTrajectory,
506  label = "Resulting Position"
507  )
508  plt.legend()
509  plt.show()
